title: Can a person who does not have an actual bottom baseline for needs and rhythms truly be imitable? What are the problems?
author: joshualinog
excerpt: # Can a person who does not have an actual bottom baseline for needs and rhythms truly be imitable? What are the problems?
content:
# Can a person who does not have an actual bottom baseline for needs and rhythms truly be imitable? What are the problems?

What about the baseline of someone who was bedridden after an accident? We need to throw off flotsam and Jetson, we need to jettison the excess. Almost like a drag racing car throwing off weight Hebrews 12
